gensokyo Package¶

gensokyo Package¶

collision Module¶

class gensokyo.collision.CollisionManager¶

Bases: builtins.object

Collision Manager

On every tick/update, checks all added collision components for collisions. Uses weak references so components garbage collect normally. Each component is associated with a dictionary of collision handlers. The key is the class whose collision against triggers the handler.

{
    class: {
        component: {
            type: method,
            ...
        },
        ...
    }
}

self.components[class][component][other_class] = method

Declare handlers attribute on component:

comp.handlers = {A:method}

When CollisionManager detects comp has collided with another registered component other that is an instance of A, it calls method(comp, other).

add(component)¶

Adds handlers of component.

First checks for instance attribute chandlers and adds handlers if has. Else checks for class attribute chandlers.

add_handlers(component, handlers)¶

Add handlers and associate with component

Parameters:handlers (dict) – {class: method,...}
update(dt)¶

class gensokyo.object.Container¶

Bases: pyglet.event.EventDispatcher

Container for Components

Keeps a reference to components to keep alive. Propagates updates to components with update method.

class gensokyo.physics.FreePhysicsComp(n=1)¶

Bases: pyglet.event.EventDispatcher

Free Physics Component

Provides simple single velocity movement, with physics vectors to an arbitrary degree (v, dv, ddv, ...)

On update, sends on_dx and on_dy according to v and dt. Then it changes v according to dv and dt. And so on.

Get/set methods take an index i which refers to the ‘degree’ of the vector. 0 is v, 1 is dv, 2 is ddv, and so on.

event_types = ['on_dx', 'on_dy']¶
get_dir(i)¶
get_mag(i)¶
get_vector(i)¶
set_dir(i, value)¶
set_mag(i, value)¶
set_vector(i, vector)¶
update(dt)¶
